name: SampleTrackr
user_description: An inventory management app to track product samples and bundles with a seamless barcode/QR checkout workflow.

import React from 'react'; import { Card, CardContent, CardHeader, CardTitle } from "@/components/ui/card"; import { Badge } from "@/components/ui/badge"; import { Link } from 'react-router-dom'; import { createPageUrl } from '@/utils'; import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"; import { Box, Package, QrCode, ArrowRight, Scan, CheckCircle, Info } from 'lucide-react'; export default function README() { return (

Inventory Manager

A comprehensive inventory management system for tracking product samples and bundles with barcode/QR checkout workflow.

{/* Quick Start */} Quick Start
{/* Demo Data */} Demo Data

This app comes pre-loaded with demo data to help you explore all features:

100 Sample Products

Beauty products from brands like Glow Labs, Pure Skin, Luxe Beauty, Seoul Glow, and more.

15 Bundles

Collections like Summer Beauty Essentials, K-Beauty Favorites, and Travel Minis.

Sample Codes: Try scanning codes like SMP-001 through SMP-100 for samples, or BND-SUMMER-001 through BND-SUN-015 for bundles.

{/* How Scanning Works */} How Scanning Works

The checkout station supports both barcode scanners and manual entry:

1

Keyboard Wedge Scanners

Most USB barcode scanners work as "keyboard wedge" devices - they type the barcode value like a keyboard. The app detects rapid key sequences and automatically processes them as scans.

2

Manual Entry

You can also type a code manually and press Enter. The scanner input stays focused automatically.

3

Code Lookup

When a code is scanned, the system first checks if it matches a sample's QR code, then checks bundles. Results appear instantly with checkout/checkin actions.

{/* Features */} Features

Sample Management

  • â€¢ Create, edit, delete samples
  • â€¢ Track status (available, checked out, reserved, discontinued)
  • â€¢ Fire sale flagging
  • â€¢ Price tracking with best price source
  • â€¢ TikTok affiliate links
  • â€¢ Image upload support
  • â€¢ Filter by brand, status, location

Bundle Management

  • â€¢ Group samples into bundles
  • â€¢ Single QR code for entire bundle
  • â€¢ Add/remove samples from bundles
  • â€¢ Shared location for bundle items

Checkout Workflow

  • â€¢ Scan samples or bundles
  • â€¢ Check out/in individual items
  • â€¢ Bulk checkout for bundles
  • â€¢ Track who items are checked out to
  • â€¢ Recent scans history

Audit Trail

  • â€¢ Transaction history for all actions
  • â€¢ Track checkout/checkin timestamps
  • â€¢ Operator tracking

Checked Out Currently in use
Reserved Reserved for future use
Discontinued No longer available

messages.content:
Build a small inventory management web app for tracking individual product samples and bundles, with a barcode/QR checkout workflow.

Core concepts

Sample: an individual inventory item. Fields: name/title, brand, location (text), qr_code/barcode (unique), picture (image URL with optional upload support if easy), tiktok_affiliate_link (URL), fire_sale (boolean), status enum (available, checked_out, reserved, discontinued), pricing fields (current_price, best_price, best_price_source/url, last_price_checked_at). Also track checkout metadata (checked_out_at, checked_in_at, checked_out_to as free-text, notes).
Bundle: a grouping of samples that shares a single QR code and a location. Fields: name, location, qr_code (unique), notes. Relationship: bundle contains many samples (samples can be assigned/unassigned to a bundle).
Optional but recommended: a simple InventoryTransaction/audit table to record checkin/checkout events (timestamp, action, sample_id, bundle_id, scanned_code, operator/checked_out_to text) so the workflow is traceable.
Database

Use SQLite for simplicity.
Create migrations/schema with proper indexes: unique indexes on samples.qr_code and bundles.qr_code; indexes on samples.status, samples.brand, samples.location, samples.bundle_id; index on transactions.sample_id and created_at.
Seed demo data with Faker: 100 samples, 15 bundles; random brands/locations; assign some samples to bundles; random fire_sale flags and statuses (mostly available). Generate plausible TikTok affiliate URLs.
Backend/API

Provide a JSON REST API:
/api/samples: full CRUD
/api/samples/:id/checkout and /api/samples/:id/checkin actions that update status and write a transaction.
/api/bundles: full CRUD
/api/bundles/:id/add_sample and /api/bundles/:id/remove_sample (or equivalent) for managing samples in bundles.
/api/lookup?code=XXXX: resolve a scanned code; return whether it matches a sample or a bundle and include the data needed by the checkout UI (sample details or bundle + samples).
Frontend/UI

Build a clean admin-style Bootstrap UI with a main navigation bar that has tabs: Samples, Bundles, Checkout.
Samples pages: index table with search/filter (brand, status, fire_sale, location), show page, new/edit forms. Display picture thumbnail, TikTok link, fire sale badge, status badge, current/best price fields. Show QR code value and optionally render a QR image.
Bundles pages: index/show/new/edit. Show bundle QR code and list of samples inside the bundle with add/remove controls.
Checkout page (Inventory::Checkout): a scanner-focused page with real-time barcode scanner input detection (keyboard-wedge scanners). Implement the typical pattern: keep a hidden/visible focused input, capture rapid key events into a buffer, on Enter (or after a short inactivity threshold) treat it as a scan. Then call /api/lookup and display the result.
If a Sample is scanned: show its picture/brand/name, status, location, fire sale, pricing, TikTok link, and buttons: Checkout / Checkin (depending on current status) plus an optional â€˜Reserveâ€™ toggle.
If a Bundle is scanned: show bundle info and the contained samples; provide Checkout/Checkin actions that apply to all eligible samples (e.g., checkout all available samples in the bundle).
Keep the page fast: immediate feedback, error state when code not found, and a recent scans list.
Internationalization

Add i18n structure with en-US strings for all labels, statuses, buttons, flash messages, and navigation, so the UI text is not hard-coded and can be extended later.
General

Follow common CRUD patterns and consistent styling across pages. Ensure forms validate required fields (brand, qr_code, status) and URLs. Make sure QR/barcode values are easy to copy. Provide sensible defaults when creating new records.
Include a short README inside the project explaining how to use the app, how scanning works, and what demo data exists.

Looking at this request, I need to clarify something important: Base44 is a platform that uses its own backend-as-a-service with entities (not SQLite), and it's built on React with Tailwind CSS (not Bootstrap). I'll adapt your requirements to work within this platform while maintaining the core functionality.

## Plan

**Key Features:**
1. **Sample Management** - Track individual inventory items with all specified fields
2. **Bundle Management** - Group samples together with shared QR codes
3. **Checkout Workflow** - Scanner-focused page for barcode/QR scanning with keyboard wedge support
4. **Transaction Logging** - Audit trail for all checkout/checkin events
5. **Search & Filtering** - Find samples by brand, status, location, fire sale flag

**Design Language:**
- Clean, modern admin interface with a sophisticated color palette
- Primary: Slate/Gray tones with indigo accents
- Status badges with semantic colors (green=available, amber=checked out, blue=reserved, gray=discontinued)
- Fire sale items highlighted with red/orange accents
- Generous whitespace, smooth transitions

**App Structure:**
- **Pages:** Samples (list), SampleDetail, SampleForm, Bundles, BundleDetail, BundleForm, Checkout
- **Components:** SampleCard, StatusBadge, ScannerInput, RecentScans, BundleSampleList, PriceDisplay
- **Layout:** Navigation with tabs for Samples, Bundles, Checkout

{"file_path": "pages/README.jsx", "content": "import React from 'react'; import { Card, CardContent, CardHeader, CardTitle } from "@/components/ui/card"; import { Badge } from "@/components/ui/badge"; import { Link } from 'react-router-dom'; import { createPageUrl } from '@/utils'; import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"; import { Box, Package, QrCode, ArrowRight, Scan, CheckCircle, Info } from 'lucide-react'; export default function README() { return (

Inventory Manager

A comprehensive inventory management system for tracking product samples and bundles with barcode/QR checkout workflow.

{/* Quick Start */} Quick Start
{/* Demo Data */} Demo Data

This app comes pre-loaded with demo data to help you explore all features:

100 Sample Products

Beauty products from brands like Glow Labs, Pure Skin, Luxe Beauty, Seoul Glow, and more.

15 Bundles

Collections like Summer Beauty Essentials, K-Beauty Favorites, and Travel Minis.

Sample Codes: Try scanning codes like SMP-001 through SMP-100 for samples, or BND-SUMMER-001 through BND-SUN-015 for bundles.

{/* How Scanning Works */} How Scanning Works

The checkout station supports both barcode scanners and manual entry:

1

Keyboard Wedge Scanners

Most USB barcode scanners work as "keyboard wedge" devices - they type the barcode value like a keyboard. The app detects rapid key sequences and automatically processes them as scans.

2

Manual Entry

You can also type a code manually and press Enter. The scanner input stays focused automatically.

3

Code Lookup

When a code is scanned, the system first checks if it matches a sample's QR code, then checks bundles. Results appear instantly with checkout/checkin actions.

{/* Features */} Features

Sample Management

  • â€¢ Create, edit, delete samples
  • â€¢ Track status (available, checked out, reserved, discontinued)
  • â€¢ Fire sale flagging
  • â€¢ Price tracking with best price source
  • â€¢ TikTok affiliate links
  • â€¢ Image upload support
  • â€¢ Filter by brand, status, location

Bundle Management

  • â€¢ Group samples into bundles
  • â€¢ Single QR code for entire bundle
  • â€¢ Add/remove samples from bundles
  • â€¢ Shared location for bundle items

Checkout Workflow

  • â€¢ Scan samples or bundles
  • â€¢ Check out/in individual items
  • â€¢ Bulk checkout for bundles
  • â€¢ Track who items are checked out to
  • â€¢ Recent scans history

Audit Trail

  • â€¢ Transaction history for all actions
  • â€¢ Track checkout/checkin timestamps
  • â€¢ Operator tracking

Available Ready for checkout
Checked Out Currently in use
Reserved Reserved for future use
Discontinued No longer available

messages.content:
I've built a complete inventory management web app with the following:

**Core Features:**
- **Samples:** 100 demo products with name, brand, location, QR code, image, TikTok affiliate links, fire sale flags, status (available/checked out/reserved/discontinued), and pricing fields
- **Bundles:** 15 demo bundles that group samples together with a single QR code
- **Checkout Station:** Barcode/QR scanner page with keyboard-wedge support that detects rapid keystrokes, displays item details, and allows check-in/out operations

**UI Highlights:**
- Clean admin-style design with three main tabs (Samples, Bundles, Checkout)
- Responsive grid/list view for samples with filters by brand, status, location, and fire sale
- Sample cards show thumbnails, pricing, status badges, and TikTok links
- Bundle management with add/remove sample controls
- Real-time scanner input with recent scans history
- Full CRUD operations for samples and bundles

**Demo Data:**
- Try scanning codes like `SMP-001` to `SMP-100` for samples
- Bundle codes: `BND-SUMMER-001`, `BND-SKIN-002`, etc.

**i18n Ready:** All text is stored in a translations file for easy localization.
